ob-desc:
{{desc|name=OpenBadges|url=https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Extension:OpenBadges}}
Short description of the openbadges extension (implements Mozilla OpenBadges)
badgecreate: Title of special page for adding new badges to the database
ob-create-badge-name: Form field, name designation for a new badge
ob-create-badge-description: Form field, description for a new badge
ob-create-badge-image: Form field, image file for a new badge
ob-create-badge-criteria: Form field, criteria for a new badge
ob-create-no-image: Error message if image does not exist
ob-create-wrong-mime: Error message if image is not of the right file type
ob-create-name-exists: Error message if badge name is already in use
badgeview: Title of special page for viewing badges awarded to the current user
ob-view-proof: Link handle to view assertion claim
ob-view-proof-header:
Table header for assertion claim links
{{Identical|Proof}}
ob-view-evidence: Link handle to view the evidence claim
ob-view-evidence-header:
Table header for evidence claim links
{{Identical|Evidence}}
ob-view-no-evidence:
Placeholder when there is no evidence claim
{{Identical|None}}
badgeissue: Title of special page for issuing badges to users
ob-issue-type:
Name or type of badge, form field to input the name of the badge that will be awarded
{{Identical|Badge}}
ob-issue-evidence: Evidence URL, form field to input the url of the evidence supporting the badge being awarded
ob-db-user-not-found: Error message if user does not exist
ob-db-user-no-email:
Error message if user hasn't entered an email address. Parameters:
* $1 - username, used for GENDER support
ob-db-evidence-not-url: Error message if the evidence is not a URL
ob-db-badge-not-found: Error message if badge does not exist
ob-db-unknown-error: Error message for unknown database error
ob-db-error-issued: Error message if this badge has already been issued to the user. This is a fatal error. In this code path, GENDER is not supported.
